00029 static SMBData smb;                        
00030 
00035 void SMBusInit()
00036 {
00037     // Set own slave address
00038     TWAR = SMB_OWN_ADDRESS << 1;
00039     // Enable TWI-interface, enable ACK, enable interrupt, clear interrupt flag
00040     TWCR = (1 << TWINT) | (1 << TWEN) | (1 << TWIE) | (1 << TWEA);
00041 }
00042

00048 void SMBEnable(void)
00049 {
00050     smb.enable = TRUE;
00051 }
00052 
00053 
00060 void SMBDisable(void)
00061 {
00062     smb.enable = FALSE;
00063 }

00073 unsigned char SMBError(void)
00074 {
00075     return smb.error;
00076 }

00083 #pragma vector = TWI_VECT
00084 __interrupt void SMBus_ISR(void)
00085 {
00086     unsigned char enableACK;
00087     unsigned char temp;
00088 
00089     // Enable ACKing if not explicitly disabled later in this ISR.
00090     enableACK = TRUE;
00091 
00092     // Is this the start of a protocol?
00093     if (smb.state == SMB_STATE_IDLE)
00094     {
00095         // Reset SMBus variables.
00096         smb.txLength = 0;
00097         smb.txCount = 0;
00098         smb.rxCount = 0;
00099         smb.error = FALSE;
00100 #ifdef SMB_SUPPORT_PEC
00101         smb.pec = 0;
00102 #endif //SMB_SUPPORT_PEC
00103 
00104     }
00105 
00106     // Use the TWI status information to make desicions.
00107     switch (TWSR & 0xf8)
00108     {
00109         case 0x60:      // SLA + W received, ACK returned
00110         {
00111             // State should be IDLE when SLA+W is received. If SLA+W is received
00112             // and state is not IDLE, an error has probably occured in an earlier
00113             // transmission that could not be detected at the time. Nothing can be
00114             // done to rescue the last transmission, but the SMBus driver variables
00115             // should be reset so the ongoing transmission can complete correctly.
00116           if (smb.state != SMB_STATE_IDLE)
00117           {
00118               smb.txLength = 0;
00119               smb.txCount = 0;
00120               smb.rxCount = 0;
00121               smb.error = FALSE;
00122 #ifdef SMB_SUPPORT_PEC
00123               smb.pec = 0;
00124 #endif //SMB_SUPPORT_PEC
00125           }
00126           smb.state = SMB_STATE_WRITE_REQUESTED;
00127 
00128 #ifdef SMB_SUPPORT_PEC
00129           SMBcrc(SMB_OWN_ADDRESS_W);
00130 #endif //SMB_SUPPORT_PEC
00131           break;
00132         }
00133 
00134         case 0x80:      // Previously addressed with own SLA+W, data received, ACK returned
00135         {
00136             // Store data received in receive buffer and increase receive count.
00137             temp = TWDR;
00138             smb.rxBuffer[smb.rxCount] = temp;
00139             smb.rxCount++;
00140 
00141 #ifdef SMB_SUPPORT_PEC
00142             // Calculate PEC.
00143             SMBcrc(temp);
00144 #endif
00145             // If the receive buffer is full, disable ACKing of the next data byte.
00146             if (smb.rxCount == SMB_RX_BUFFER_LENGTH)
00147             {
00148                 enableACK = FALSE;
00149             }
00150             break;
00151         }
00152 
00153         case 0x88:      // Previously addressed with own SLA+W, data received, NACK returned.
00154         {
00155             smb.error = TRUE;
00156             smb.state = SMB_STATE_IDLE;
00157             break;
00158         }
00159 
00160         case 0xa0:   // P or Sr received while still addressed.
00161         {
00162             ProcessMessage(&smb);
00163             break;
00164         }
00165 
00166         case 0xa8:  // Own SLA +R received, ACK returned.
00167         {
00168             // Calculate PEC of own address + R.
00169 #ifdef SMB_SUPPORT_PEC
00170             SMBcrc(SMB_OWN_ADDRESS_R);
00171 #endif
00172             if (smb.state == SMB_STATE_IDLE) // Receive byte.
00173             {
00174                 ProcessReceiveByte(&smb);
00175                 smb.state = SMB_STATE_READ_REQUESTED;
00176             }
00177 
00178             // Make the first byte of txBuffer ready for transmission.
00179             temp = smb.txBuffer[0];
00180             TWDR = temp;
00181             smb.txCount++;
00182 
00183 #ifdef SMB_SUPPORT_PEC
00184             // Calculate PEC of sent byte.
00185             SMBcrc(temp);
00186 #endif
00187 
00188             break;
00189         }
00190 
00191         case 0xb8:      // Data byte in TWDR transmitted, ACK received.
00192         {
00193             if (smb.txCount == smb.txLength)
00194             {
00195 #ifdef SMB_SUPPORT_PEC
00196                 TWDR = smb.pec;     // If PEC is enabled, an ACK is OK here.
00197 #else
00198                 smb.error = TRUE;   // If PEC is disabled, an ACK here is an error.
00199 #endif //SMB_SUPPORT_PEC
00200                 enableACK = FALSE;
00201             }
00202             else
00203             {
00204                 temp = smb.txBuffer[smb.txCount];
00205                 TWDR = temp;
00206                 smb.txCount++;
00207                 #ifdef SMB_SUPPORT_PEC
00208                 SMBcrc(temp);
00209                 #endif
00210 
00211             }
00212             break;
00213         }
00214 
00215         case 0xc0:      // Data byte in TWDR transmitted, NACK received.
00216         {
00217             if (smb.txCount != smb.txLength)
00218             {
00219                 // Error, NACK is only expected after last data byte or PEC.
00220                 smb.error = TRUE;
00221             }
00222             smb.state = SMB_STATE_IDLE;
00223             break;
00224         }
00225 
00226         case 0xc8:      // Last data byte in TWDR transmitted, ACK received.
00227         {
00228             smb.error = TRUE;
00229             smb.state = SMB_STATE_IDLE;
00230             break;
00231         }
00232 
00233         case 0x00:      // Bus error due to an illegal START or STOP condition.
00234         {
00235             TWCR |= (1 << TWSTO);
00236             smb.error = TRUE;
00237             smb.state = SMB_STATE_IDLE;
00238             break;
00239         }
00240 
00241         default:        // Unexpected TWSR value, error.
00242         {
00243 
00244             smb.error = TRUE;
00245             smb.state = SMB_STATE_IDLE;
00246             break;
00247         }
00248     }
00249 
00250     // Issue next TWI command.
00251     if (enableACK)
00252     {
00253         // Set TWEA flag and don't clear TWINT (if set) at the same time.
00254         temp = TWCR;
00255         temp |= (1 << TWEA);
00256         temp &= ~(1 << TWINT);
00257         TWCR = temp;
00258     }
00259     else
00260     {
00261         // Clear TWEA flag and make sure that TWINT is not cleared at the same time.
00262         TWCR &= ~((1 << TWEA) | (1 << TWINT));
00263     }
00264 
00265     TWCR |= (1 << TWEN) | (1 << TWIE) | (1 << TWINT);
00266 }
00267

00306 
00307  /* \brief PEC CRC lookup function
00308   *
00309   * This function uses a table stored in flash to look up the
00310   * PEC value of one byte, using the PEC calculated so far as a
00311   * starting point.
00312   *
00313   * \param  data    Value to calculate PEC of.
00314   * \param  pec     Pointer to current PEC.
00315   */
00316 #pragma inline
00317 static void SMBcrc(unsigned char data)
00318 {
00319     smb.pec ^= data;
00320     smb.pec = crcTable[smb.pec];
00321 }
00322 #endif //SMB_USE_PEC_LOOKUP
00323 
00324 
00325 #ifdef SMB_USE_PEC_CALCULATION
00326  /* \brief PEC CRC lookup function
00327   *
00328   * This function calculates the PEC value of one byte, using the
00329   * PEC calculated so far as a starting point.
00330   *
00331   * \param  data    Value to calculate PEC of.
00332   * \param  pec     Pointer to current PEC.
00333   */
00334 // PEC calculation routine
00335 static void SMBcrc(unsigned char data)
00336 {
00337     unsigned char i;    // Counter for 8 shifts
00338 
00339     smb.pec ^= data;        // Initial XOR
00340 
00341     i = 8;
00342     do
00343     {
00344         if (smb.pec & 0x80)
00345         {
00346             smb.pec <<= 1;
00347             smb.pec ^= SMB_CRC_POLYNOME;
00348         }
00349         else
00350         {
00351             smb.pec <<= 1;
00352         }
00353     }
00354     while(--i);
00355 }
00356 #endif //SMB_USE_PEC_CALCULATION
